title.native: キングスレイド 意志を継ぐものたち
title.english: KING's RAID: Successors of the Will

description:
The story is set in a world of sword and sorcery a century after King Kairu of Orvelia defeated the demon king Angumundo. The squire Kasel lives in these peaceful times. However, Kasel's destiny is set in motion when he hears of the demons reappearing on his land. Guided by a great wise man, Kasel embarks on an adventure with his companions to drive back the darkness threatening his once peaceful land and become the Chosen Warrior of the Holy Sword Aea.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Elf
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is an elf.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

node.description:
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/濱野高年)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/池田繁美)

Founder and representative director of Atelier Musa.

**[Profile (ONEMUSIC)](http://one-music.jp/tokuda/index.html)**

Masahiro Tokuda is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and guitarist.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/152630/)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yoshiyama_yuu)

She got her start at Studio Muu under [Hiromi Muranaka](https://anilist.co/staff/143692/)'s guidance. Heavily influenced by the works of [Masahito Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/138566/), [Yoshinori Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) and [Masami Oobari](https://anilist.co/staff/100660/). Regular presence in [Toei](https://anilist.co/studio/18/)'s shows, specifically the [Precure](https://anilist.co/anime/100661/) franchise.

Her animation is characterized by impact frames, dark shadows, thick outlines, and overly expressive hands.

Also a die-hard fan of insects.

fripSide is a Japanese indie pop band. Started in 2002. They also have many other support members.  

On March 15, 2009, nao stated on the fripSide Official Website that she had graduated from fripSide. Sat and nao want to pursue different musical careers, as nao intends to pursue a solo singing career. Meanwhile Sat will continue in fripSide with a new project called, fripside: THE NEXT PROJECT. Seiyuu Yoshino Nanjo took over as the vocalist of fripSide with her debut single "only my railgun", the opening of the anime, To Aru Kagaku no Railgun. 

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Members__
- sat - [Satoshi Yaginuma](https://anilist.co/staff/111757) (八木沼悟志) - (lyrics, synthesizers, composer, arrangement) (2002-present)
- Mao Uesugi (上杉真央) - (vocals) (2022-present)
- Hisayo Abe (阿部寿世) - (vocals) (2022-present)

__Former Members__
- [nao](https://anilist.co/staff/118365/nao) (vocal, lyrics) (2002-2009)
- [Yoshino Nanjo](https://anilist.co/staff/96592/Yoshino-Nanjo) (南條愛乃) - (vocals, lyrics) (2009-2022)

[Official Website](https://kotoko.asia) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/06F1MiFx0dHLHEPQBIrcr9?autoplay=true) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kotoko-kirakira/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/KOTOKO_Dwarf) | [Warner Home Video](http://whv-amusic.com/kotoko/) | [NBC Universal Japan](http://nbcuni-music.com/kotoko/) | [YouTube ](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYZ9uuJYYP5PX8YvpIHbEwQ)

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

Twitter __Satoshi Yaginuma__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger, lyricist, music producer, synthesizer keyboarder, and guitarist. He is part of the pop duo fripSide and the hip-hop/synthpop trio ALTIMA. He is also the CEO of p.m.works, Inc.

__DECO*27__ (pronounced as Deko Niina) is a Fukuoka-born Vocaloid song producer and utaite who made his debut in October 2008. His first work got over 100,000 views.

KOTOKO is a Japanese J-pop musician, singer and songwriter. She began her singing career as a member of [I've Sound ](https://anilist.co/staff/106951/Ive) in 2000, and was later signed to Rondorobe under Geneon from 2004 to 2010. Kotoko left Geneon in 2010, left I've Sound and signed to Warner Home Video in 2011. She composes and writes lyrics (for herself as well as other singers in I've Sound) for numerous other song collections. She has contributed songs to numerous anime and video games.

[Website](http://www.dreamcatcher7.com/) | [Website (Japanese)](https://dreamcatcher-official.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hf_dreamcatcher) | [Twitter (Japanese)](https://twitter.com/jp_dreamcatcher) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/happyfacedreamcatcher) | [Facebook (Japanese)](https://www.facebook.com/dreamcatcherjapan) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hf_dreamcatcher/) | [Instagram (Japanese)](https://www.instagram.com/jp_dreamcatcher/) | [V Live](https://www.vlive.tv/channel/E8D2CB)

DREAMCATCHER is a South Korean girl group formed by Happy Face Entertainment. They officially debuted on August 9, 2014 under the name "MINX." Adding two new members, the group re-debuted on January 13, 2017 under the name "Dreamcatcher" with the single album Nightmare.

__Members:__
• JiU (지유) – leader, vocalist
• SuA (수아) – main dancer, vocalist
• Siyeon (시연) – main vocalist
• Handong (한동) – sub vocal
• Yoohyeon (유현) – lead vocalist
• Dami (다미) – main rapper
• Gahyeon (가현) – sub vocal, rapper

__Height:__ 157 cm
__Weight:__ 46 kg

Riho Iida is a Japanese ex-child model-turned-actress, voice actress and singer.
